Capture the Flag Training

Capture the Flag (CTF) is a computer security exercise where there is a "Flag" secretly hidden within a purposely vulnerable program or website. The objective is to steal the flag from other competitors in an attack/defense style CTF or from the organizors in a jeopardy-style challenge.

CTF competitions are a fun way to advance, challenge, and prove your cybersecurity skills. You can compete individualy or as a team. CTF problems are asked in job interviews to test the skills of professionals. So, competing in CTF competitions may prepare you for cybersecurity job interviews as well.


CTF Training Links

There are numerous places you can visit for Capture the Flag training. A very popular one that we like to use is HACKTHEBOX. Here you can start your CTF training or just jump straight in to some of the more skillful challenges. Below is a list of links to Capture the flag training sites, some of which are made by are own Cyberknights.

  • OverTheWire
  • CTFLEARN
  • HackThisSite.org
  • MicroCorruption
  • Tyler Rasmussen's CTF Challenge
  • Hacksplaining
